website_summaries.verdict: Excellent quality by a popular brand. These diapers provide cute graphics, versatile sizes, and easy-to-use snaps for a decent price. A great option for novices who are ready to give cloth diapers a try.
pros: Suitable for boys and girls, and available in numerous print options
Come in several sizes, so options are available for babies weighing about 6 1/2 to 33 lbs
Snaps are simple to fasten, making adjustments easy
cons: Occasional leaks are possible, but this is a concern with almost any diaper

customer_reviews.title: Not really Alvas.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these thinking they were Alvas, but they are not. Three of them don't have labels, and the other three are labeled 'BestoBaby'. They are not the same quality as my actual Alvas. While the PUL holds in liquids, I get a lot of leaks through the stitching. I don't have this problem with any of my other diapers, just these six.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M Karrar

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy these diapers. Do your research and buy a better brand. These diapers lasted me barely a year. After that they continuously leaked everytime my daughter peed. My wash routine is perfect, this isn't my first rodeo with cloth diapers. I even tried stripping them and that also didn't even help with the leakage. Now they have gotten to the point where they won't even hold her urine in, it repels it. Sending it down her legs and as soon as I open the diaper pee pours out. Easy to say I am throwing these diapers in the trash, just like the garbage they are.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money for me!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this works for others, each time I have used this diapers for my toddler it didn't work! It leaks and leaves my baby soaked and even the bed; you would think he wasn't wearing any diaper at all! So annoyed with this product! I followed all the instructions, even after boiling the inserts and washing the inserts and diapers several times to increase absorption, it didn't make a difference. total waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Didi

customer_reviews.title: The only brand we've used
customer_reviews.text: Our family is late to the cloth diapering game, but we are so glad we are here! We bought these from a friend's recommendation & they work just fine for our 16-month-old. It was a smooth transition from disposable to these. Her diapers last about 2 hours without needing to be changed & she as had no problems with rashes or irritated skin. The diapers fit nicely & look cute too! One thing to note, though, is we are having a hard time figuring out how to make it through the night with leaks. At this point, we have just stuck with disposable for sleep. Hoping we get the hang of it eventually!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Sihotang

customer_reviews.title: PUL is trashed.
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had these diapers for a few months, maybe 5. They were alright. Did the job. My son always leaked but he’s a heavy wetter so I thought I should get different inserts. I got some hemp inserts and they seem to do the trick. Until today. He got wet from the center of the diaper. I go to look at the pul, trash. I dry on low and wag on warm. I use tide powder, which is recommended by all the cloth diapering groups on Facebook. These are cheap, yes, but not when you have to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Insert ripped
customer_reviews.text: One of the inserts came ripped already. Did not notice until after I washed them to prepare them for baby (gentle cycle and low dry). I have not tried these on my baby yet. I really don’t wanna have to go through the trouble of sending all of them back I’m hoping the company will just send me another insert. I also ordered a set of baby goal diaper. They are a little thicker and the inserts seemed much better quality. Everyone online raved about all the baby but the diapers seem less durable Everyone online raved about all the baby but the diapers seem less durable.
customer_reviews.author: PianoBuysAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Vomit inducing delivery
customer_reviews.text: They arrived soaked in what smells like fish juice. Absolutely disgusting. *update: Amazon would not accept return. I opened box to get things broken down to recycle/throw out. They are MOLDY. Do not buy these, it’s (hah) a crapshoot if you get normal diapers or contaminated diapers.*
customer_reviews.author: R Howells

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have many Alva pocket diapers and love them! They fit my son so well. These were the first cloth diapers I ever bought and they are my favorite. I have only had them a couple months but they have not been a disappointment! Only thing I did is upgrade the inserts since my son is a heavy wetter, the microfiber inserts just don’t cut it for him. You can totally use the microfiber inserts around the house to dust and stuff if you choose to. The diapers arrived speedily and packaged nicely. They came with cleaning instructions which was nice since they were my first diaper purchase. The green diaper is actually a pretty bright yellow-green, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: A. TorresTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.text: My son is about 10 lbs. Needs the small size setting and works like a dream! No blow outs so far and his diaper rash is significantly reduced and almost gone. Been using for about 4 days. Keeps him much dryer. Poop color will do through diaper shell into the liner inside. Highly recommend "diaper shower" before washing in machine. (I have one of the sprayers that connect to the toilet and a splash shield to rinse off poop before I put them in my wet/dry bag. All colors and odors come out in the wash. I use sun triple clean free and clear). Love the adjustability of these diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Razzie

customer_reviews.title: Defective- missing button, poor customer service to address issue.
customer_reviews.text: Received a defective diaper (missing the thigh snap). The response I received from Alvababys customer service was a joke. They offered to refund me $2 and advised me to find a repair shop to have it fixed. Seriously?? $2 doesn’t even cover the cost of the original diaper, and secondly- thanks for the help but I’m not spending more money to fix your products defect. Just go with LBB diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket diapers
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended these and they do not disappoint. My first time cloth diapering and these work great. Haven't had any issues with leaking. They wash well and come out very clean. They just barely fit my 9 week old son (he's a little peanut though, 22 percentile for height and weight, proportionate at least! ;) I have mama koala too which are slightly easier to snap and fit my peanut a little better because they must be slightly smaller, but these aren't bad by any means. I like that these come with 2 inserts per diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Sommer

customer_reviews.title: The elastics are great on these diapers
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These China cheapo's are really very well made. The elastics are great on these diapers, way better then my BG's, which need to be replaced after the first child. They fit my skinny leg babe great, who's now 10.5 mo. I like to use these as our "going-out" diaper. The only thing that I like better about the BG's is their minky-fleece liners, which don't "pill-up" like the fleece on the Alva's. The inserts are pretty good too. I've been pairing one of the Alva inserts with a doubler that's not as thick. Overall, really nice, good quality cloth diaper for cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoe Gal

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these diapers. So does baby. No more gross, sticky gel on his butt from the disposables. Baby is so happy with these and is testing them to the limit. These are super easy to use. The poop flips right out of the diaper with minimal mess when it’s time to clean them. The inserts hold an incredible amount of pee. The only thing I miss about disposables is the wetness indicator. Other than trying to find a dependable way to tell when it is time to change a diaper before it leaks, these are wonderful. I am definitely going to order more in the future. I wish I had switched to cloth diapering sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Shark

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but really great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Generally, they're a little bit leaky, and obviously they don't last as long as disposables, but if you're trying to test out cloth diapers to see if it's for you, these are a great place to start. Don't spend a ton on other cloth diapers just to find out they all have pretty much the same pitfalls. Nothing's as great as disposables... other than maybe having a habitable planet not stuffed full of gross diapers... I do enjoy that.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Beaverhausen

customer_reviews.title: Save moneh
customer_reviews.text: I love them. My baby girl is 7 months and the fact that I’m not spending so much money on disposable diapers is a relief economically. I use these diapers for night with a different cloth since it won’t last for the whole night. However, in the day each diaper will last around 5-7 hours with two whites diapers cloth. The absorbency of only using one white cloth will make you have to wash a lot, but two will work just perfect
customer_reviews.author: JAIME DE LA MORA

customer_reviews.title: Very nice diaper
customer_reviews.text: New grandma here and I was a cloth diaper user with my kids many moons ago. Bring full time daycare to baby I could not bring myself to use disposable diapers. Theses seemed interesting so I tried them. I Love these and figured if every new parent tried them they would convert from disposable diapers. Easy and the ability to insert an extra pad if needed. Easy to wash and dry. I use a liner so if it’s a poo I just drop liner in trash and it’s ready to wash at end of day.
customer_reviews.author: biking lady

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and absorbent. Easier to user than prefolds. This is the only way to get my hubby on board to switch from disposable to cloth diapers. We still use disposable during night. But I am thinking with two inserts, we can have enough absorbency for the night. The price is great! Quality is great. I strongly recommend Alvababy. The alvababy official website offers more products with cheaper prices. I’ll purchase more from them.
customer_reviews.author: MyraZha

customer_reviews.title: No leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with these cloth diapers. I wasn’t expecting too much given the price, but they are fantastic! The outer fabric is soft and kind of stretchy. The inner fabric is soft and so far is holding up well to daily washing. The snaps seem very strong and like they will last. Most importantly, no leaks! I did purchase the Alva 5 layer bamboo inserts (3 layers microfiber sandwiched between 2 layers of bamboo) to use in these and have not used the microfiber inserts that were included. My daughter seems very comfortable in these diapers and I definitely recommend. I just order more!
customer_reviews.author: P. Isner

customer_reviews.title: these worked much better, but I was still having leaks
customer_reviews.text: These cloth diapers are okay. I learned very quickly that the microfiber inserts don't hold much liquid and that they do hold smells. After switching to prefolds, these worked much better, but I was still having leaks. The only way I stopped having leaks with these diapers was to use them as covers instead of as pockets. I still use them, but not as designed. I like the cute colors and when used as covers, they work very well. I also used these diapers as swim diapers for my daughter this summer and they worked great for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Leaky situation
customer_reviews.text: For this specific set of reusable diapers. Colors are basic. Been having leak issues for over a year now. It does seem to be dry on the inside and the insert is the one that absorbs all of what it can. The only issue I have is the leaking. I can't have my son wear it at nights. Can't have him in the highchair, Ingenuity/Bumbo. Not even sit on his playmat or he will run and slip. All because it leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Babi Gendut

customer_reviews.title: Diaper is great, inserts are temporary
customer_reviews.text: The microfiber inserts were fine except the compression leaks became a problem around 6 months old. I replaced them with some hemp inserts and the diapers are perfect. Wish there was a buying option for diapers with hemp or cotton inserts available. Worth the price, though.
customer_reviews.author: Team Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had great success with these diapers and microfiber inserts (1st time ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had great success with these diapers and microfiber inserts (1st time CD’er). I would purchase again and plan to. FYI 1. Buy it try it and then invest in other inserts if needed 2. Be sure insert is all the way in the pocket a slight over lap out of the locket and you’ll have a leak 3. Look up “alva newborn hack” I got these on a one month old no problemo with it!! 4. These colors are on point and very good for boys and girls alike. Check their website for uber cute prints and swim diapers as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the diaper. I could just use one absorbent pad for my baby and it held on well till the next change. Initially i was hesitant about buying pocket diapers but after using this its so easy peazy and it is absorbent as well. The pad inside the pocket gets soaked but the outer layer remains dry so the baby is comfortable wearing it. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Dhans

customer_reviews.title: 0 leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Update! I’ve now been using these Part time for a year now! I love them. I’ve decided to buy more recently and looked at their direct website.... they are SO much cheaper if you buy direct from their website. And they usually have free gifts if you spend so much! I got 11 printed diapers for $50 with inserts! So I’m expanding my collection and going full time.
customer_reviews.author: Etay

customer_reviews.title: Great price, no leaks
customer_reviews.text: These are more economically friendly than many other diaper options. I like the way the sizing works and I haven't had any issues with leaks. They come with extra microfiber inserts and I found that I really hate the feeling of microfiber so I ended up buying extra charcoal inserts instead. Overall, I think these diapers are great but recently I've been using Sigzagor ones instead because I like the prints better. They're very similar though.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to cloth diapering and purchased these mainly because of the price. I've been using them about a month, and I can't honestly imagine what the more expensive cloth diaper options could offer that these do not. They don't leak (as long as you change the insert often enough), they are adjustable, and they are relatively easy to wash. These have almost eliminated the need to buy disposable diapers for our family. Totally worth a little extra work!
customer_reviews.author: Anne M

customer_reviews.title: Great Cloth Diapers
customer_reviews.text: High quality cloth diapers and inserts. My baby is still a little small, but with the Alva Baby Newborn diaper hack (Youtube it! You won't regret it!), these work well just are a little bulky. I imagine these will work great as my baby gets a little bigger. I have machine washed and hung these to dry with no problems so far! The inserts, I have washed and dried on low. They continue to be absorbent with no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Katy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Absorption pads are not that great too much lint
customer_reviews.text: Too much lint while washing the diaper linings or the absorption pads. Other things are fine except for this. Pretty colors, Update: After using for a month - I see black stains forming on the absorption cloth. The outside liners are just fine and works good.
customer_reviews.author: Megha Sagar

customer_reviews.title: Best value for your money.
customer_reviews.text: Not very fancy. But gets the job done! Bought different inserts humble baby and they are perfect. Make sure to use the inserts on the inside not on the outside it will dry out babys skin.
customer_reviews.author: TYLERr

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to clean and soft on baby skin
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these diapers for about 6+ months now ...... and I wash after one time use in machine ( and dryer) ...so far I have not had any diaper rashes and or leaks ...Highly reccommend if you want to go green on your child's diapering needs
customer_reviews.author: M.prime

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers!
customer_reviews.text: These are the first cloth diapers I’ve gotten and they’ve surprised me. Not only are they super easy to use, but they work really well. With doubled up inserts, I can leave my 5mo old overnight. In 2 weeks, we have only had 1 leak so far! I love that these still have lots of room to grow with him, too!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Inserts will not absorb liquids
customer_reviews.text: The inserts are 80% polyester and 20% polyamide—they are no good. Liquids just roll through these pads. They do not hold pee. The diaper covers are ok I suppose, but buy yourself some 100% cotton prefolds to replace these crappy inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: These are BIG. I mean the diapers are so bulky. There is no way your baby will be able to wear a onesie. It looks bad. They also leak. They will probably be better for a much larger baby. Mine is currently 13.5 pounds 24 inches.
customer_reviews.author: CIJIMATT

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my 17 month old who is turning two in a few weeks. Works great, I just need to double up on liners and change about every two hours or else they will leak. I’m not too concerned about the leaking because my son drinks a lot and moves around a lot and changing a wet diaper every two hours or less is about right.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Wicks

customer_reviews.title: I did not like my experience
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the material is that touches the baby, but my baby boy became very allergic. They do not hold much. They pee and poop leaks out of diaper, when you wash it the diaper still smells like pee and poop. the more you use it the more they begin to stain.
customer_reviews.author: Jealena Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Our Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I love these! We started using cloth when our little guy was 4 months old. We have tried different kinds and these are my favorites. They have a place where you can put the liner inside the cover, but we don't do that. We just put the liner on top of the cover so that we can use the same cover through multiple diaper changes. We use cloth when we're sitting around at home and when he's at daycare, and use disposables when we're out and about and overnight. I buy about half the amount of disposable diapers as other moms that I know.
customer_reviews.author: shelley_p2

customer_reviews.title: Looooove
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the buy ! Even if just a part time cloth diaperer like us, we loooove these. Definitely not as difficult as everyone made it out to be. If I had normal access to a washing machine I would go for buying two sets of these and doing it full time !
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers for best value
customer_reviews.text: Out of all my diapers these are my favorite. They're beautifully vibrant, so adjustable, and very affordable when it comes to diapers. I think these are so practical for any parent wanting to do cloth diapers. The third snap on the wings is a huge game changer, will never but diapers without them again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hauck

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I am currently building my cloth diaper collection with different brands (bum genius, thirstiest, and Alva). My baby is 10 weeks old, so is on the smaller side for the bulk of cloth diapers. Alva so far is the least bulky, easiest to clean, leaks the least, and is the most affordable. I am new to cloth diapering, but feeling optimistic!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea S

customer_reviews.title: I use these exclusively now and very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I’ve recently switched from disposable to cloth diapers and I’m really happy with these and am using them exclusively now. My baby was a preemie so she’s still very small. The smallest snap setting works perfectly for her. I had worried about leaks because she’s so small, but I haven’t had any issues even after she had a total poo-splosion.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had these when my children were babies!
customer_reviews.text: Although these were gifts for a first-time mother (thus, I don't know how well they work), it sure looked like they were the answer to non-disposable, pin-free diapers! How I wish these were available when my children were babies! They arrived quickly, were beautiful colors, and looked like great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley J Power

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: These are a great cloth diaper for the price! There are definitely softer ones out there but these are a great price and a great quality for the price and do the job
customer_reviews.author: Shayla

customer_reviews.title: Good quality cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: The inserts and the diapers are the best quality. Having the adjustable buttons helps baby of any size. We started with just using one insert when the baby was small and added one more insert as baby grew bigger. The absorbency is good and can survive machine washing. Some of the diapers did started leaking a little after 10months of using them and the warranty coverage was excellent. Overall happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite diapers!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite of all of our diapers. I know they are China cheapies but they fit really well and don’t leak. We don’t use microfiber (ya useless and horrible for the environment!) but the actual pocket diaper is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and absorbant
customer_reviews.text: I got several of these to use for cloth diapering my baby. They're really easy to use, easy to clean, and are quite durable. I like how eco-friendly they are, so I don't have to deal with disposables.
customer_reviews.author: docile.doom

customer_reviews.title: Leak problem!
customer_reviews.text: Those diapers leak! I’ve bought 3 packages. I’ve washed them a few times according to instructions. Every night there is a major leak. Not happy with the quality!
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I loved these diapers!!! Such a great value and they lasted a full two years for my daughter and they were still in great condition for another baby. I gave 4 stars because the threads on the back did start coming loose pretty early on with a few of them, but I was able to repair them easily with my sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Beagley

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these for about 2 months. I would say they are a great buy! They fit my baby perfectly from the start. (He was not a newborn when we started cloth diapering.) They've held up great through our every other day washing. These diapers come with 2 microfiber inserts for each diaper.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopperInKY

customer_reviews.title: bulky
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me. It's too bulky and wasn't as easy to use as use and throw diapers. Cleaning these cloth inserts was another task. So I did continue using this.
customer_reviews.author: Ashwin

customer_reviews.title: Customer service sucks
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the diapers are great if all of the snaps are on their correctly. Don’t bother to contact customer service about it because they will keep sending you to someone else and the problem doesn’t get resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: doesnt hold pee as much and leaks
customer_reviews.text: have been using for past three months as night time diapers. These diapers looks good quality but doesnt hold much PEE in , they always leak on bed, no point in wearing them
customer_reviews.author: Boondock Saint

customer_reviews.title: Must-have into any cloth diaper collection
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about these due to the cheaper than most pricetag. But honestly, these are my go-to's for nighttime. I double up inserts and put one of these on for a leak-proof night. They are great since they are a bit wider than most [like charlie banana for example], which is helpful at nighttime in my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: they worked great! I have some about 6 months old and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have boughten these twice. The first time, they worked great! I have some about 6 months old and still have hardly worn except light pilling and a broken stitch in the back here and there. The second time i ordered them, none of them were remotely water proof. They leaked through immediately. I washed them a few times to make sure it wasn't user error, but they just got worse. I had to send them back, and won't order them again because it was such a pain for me to have to return them, I don't want to risk it if they'll be a good batch or not.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hermann

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Alva Baby and Mama Koala diapers for nearly 3 months now. I definitely find the Alva Baby diapers fit my baby better than the Mama Koala ones do. Perhaps its the way the snaps are aligned that is making the difference. That, and the Alva diapers have more of a curve at the edges which seems to hug my baby better. Loving the Alva Baby solid color diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Microfiber inserts splitting
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these diapers for a couple weeks and they have been through the wash twice. So far, two of my microfiber inserts have split like shown in the picture. I am following all the guidelines of washing, so I don’t really know what to do differently. Other than that though, I am really glad we switched to cloth!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after first use/wash
customer_reviews.text: Ripped after first used and washed. I just received these in the mail a few days ago and after first use and wash i found one of the liners was already starting to rip. I was going to purchase more because they seemed to clean pretty well compared to others but I am very disappointed in the quality. I guess you get what you pay for....these are much cheaper than other reusable diapers for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: reneemaude

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great diapers for the price! I am very pleased with this purchase and will definitely be buying Alvababy cloth diapers again! I am impressed with the affordability and durability. Usually when you get them for such a good price the quality is less than stellar but not in this case. Thank you Alvababy!
customer_reviews.author: Eriksson family

customer_reviews.title: Good dipers
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. I wanted to try clothe dipers and I didn’t want to get super expensive ones because what if I didn’t like it. So I got this product and omg I can’t believe how good they are and how easy tonuse clothe dipers. I will buy more of these and I don’t want to try anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressed by these!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these! For the price, they are great. Good quality fabric and design. I do use additional cotton inserts, as the microfiber ones provided aren’t that great. They do work as a really good base layer though. The colors are awesome, too. Just what I needed to give cloth diapering a go. I use these intermittently and I am no cloth diapering guru, but these seem to be a great buy if you’re not looking to or able to spend a fortune. Definitely worth a try
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: My first time using cloth diapers. They are not bad. They only problem I have, my two year old is beginning to have rashes. He had very sensitive skin, maybe I can find another brand that would work for him. Any suggestions would be helpful. As of not am sticking to cloth, wish I Knew bout this 3 years ago
customer_reviews.author: Alex/Aram

customer_reviews.title: worked better than i thought they would
customer_reviews.text: bumgenius diapers are expensive and these are a LOT cheaper and nearly just as good. I would highly recommend. they also have great pattern and color options
customer_reviews.author: paula sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. I wish it wouldn't come individually packed with plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I love using the diapers but I think it's too big. As most of the people who buy and use cloth diapers, I care about the using plastic and both this and Alva's come individually packed in plastic bags which is totally unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leaking EVER! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these cloth diapers!!! We were nervous about trying them, but they are so easy to use. I wasn't sure about inserts, but I definitely prefer them now. Our little one always had blowouts or leaks with disposable diapers and she hasn't had a single one with these cloth diapers. They are obviously more bulky than disposable, but it's not bad at all. The cloth fabric is soft and hasn't irritated our little one's bum at all. I soak the liners and the shells in oxyclean over night and the shells haven't stained one bit. The liners do stain, but not that bad and they don't smell at all. I highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Probst

customer_reviews.title: I am happy I bought this from here because I was able ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this originally, but got more from the Alva website. They were cheaper there, but here you get 2 inserts per diaper. In the Alva website I got one but the diaper was 1 dollar cheaper and was able to pick the bamboo quality. Overall, I am happy I bought this from here because I was able to try this diapers without expending too much money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love Alvababy diapers! Have been using for 4 m ok nths now, best purchase ever. So glad I read reviews and went with this product. They are sooo easy to keep clean (as long as you do the right to in ngs with washing, drying, creams, etc).
customer_reviews.author: A Nunn

customer_reviews.title: Overall great diaper so far.
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are great so far. I have ordered 3 sets. They seem comfortable and as long as the diaper holds up, they will fit my baby until he is potty trained. The only criticism I have is that they are each individually wrapped in plastic and then placed in another plastic bag. It would be nice if there were any alternative to plastic for packaging seeing as how our planet is already overflowing with plastic products.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Y’all I can not rave on these diapers enough. With my first born we bought bum genius diapers (on sale) and spent about 300$ on a lot of 30. With our second child we wanted to replace some of the older ones and went with AlvaBaby. These diapers are cheaper, softer, cuter and MORE absorbent. I have not had any leaks at all (it’s honestly shocking). Wish I had known about these before.
customer_reviews.author: The Best

customer_reviews.title: Possible counterfeits, still work great.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to try cloth diapers. I never tried them with my 7 year old and decided to take the plunge this time around. I have two sets of these. One set has the Alva Tags on the diapers and liners, one set doesn't. I don't like the non tagged liners, the shells are of the same quality. I don't feel compelled to even try another brand. They have a customizable fit that should fit up till my baby is potty trained. My kid is a heavy wetter overnight, nothing but disposables work then. These are great day time diapers. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Plankton

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well to heavy use so far
customer_reviews.text: I have limited experience with pocket diapers, but so far I have had zero problems with these. I have to use two inserts in each otherwise my daughter will leak very fast though so they are kind of bulky. But the quality seems great. I've been using them regularly for just over 3 months now and they are still as good as new. No stains or wear that I can see.
customer_reviews.author: Milena Plecha

customer_reviews.title: All good! Comfy and cute!
customer_reviews.text: Just wish I had some instructions on how to wash because a couple stained while I learned the correct process. With my first I was very hesitant to use cloth diapers, but I do like them now more of a backup because the cleanup is a lot of work, especially as a working mother. It’s hard to keep up, but luckily my husband is pretty good at it. Will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend for very small babies
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using cloth diapers and they are big on my son even when adjusted and they did leak on the side because he’s so small but I love this idea of saving money on diapers. And they are very soft
customer_reviews.author: Nakeira

customer_reviews.title: Missing buttons
customer_reviews.text: One of the 24 diapers I ordered came deffective with 2 buttons missing and in 6 months of use a button of another diaper came off. From the 4 orders of diapers, the colors vary but that's ok. I take good care of them and overall they are good diapers for the price, but i don't know how long they will last if they are starting to fall apart in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: JORGE V.

customer_reviews.title: Soft, cute, & seemingly durable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these a few days ago because I wanted to try cloth diapering for my next baby due in April of 2019. They feel so soft! I haven't been able to use them yet but they dont seem cheaply made I think they will be very durable! Now I'm searching for cloth diapers with prints from Alvababy! Lots of people love Alvababy and I think I'm going to be a permanent customer. I will definitely update to 5 stars once I get to try them out.
customer_reviews.author: Denasia parker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Us
customer_reviews.text: My LO loves these. First set of pocket diapers I bought. Have bought others since. Don’t spend $$$ on more expensive unless your baby has insanely explosive poops.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Nice cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.text: Great cloth diapers. Elastic started dying after 36 months of regular use. Still nice-looking, soft, white is white, and usable.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin C

customer_reviews.title: i can say they work great. a friend bought us some of the fancy ...
customer_reviews.text: we bought some of these for our daughter. we were told that the alva brand was cheap, but upon getting these and using them for a while, i can say they work great. a friend bought us some of the fancy ones and these are actually better quality and have more snaps and options for sizing. it took us a bit to figure out how to get all the snaps to work, but once we did, they were able to fit our one month old very well, and she's been wearing them for almost six months now. they do the trick just as well as we could expect.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Cloth doubter no more
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased 4 sets of these. I never planned on using cloth diapers but after dealing with constant leaks with my long and skinny baby, I decided to try these. They are super easy to use, have led to more sleep for my little one and they wash up very well. Fully recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: good but not great
customer_reviews.text: These leak more easily than the (more expensive) Mama Koala ones. Leaking is the major thing diapers have to not do so I think that's worth two stars.
customer_reviews.author: shalini

customer_reviews.title: Super soft and Fits 0 months to 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my baby daughter and they didn't fit her until she was about 9 lbs but they do snap all the way. I have also used these on my almost 3 year old son at night time and the fit was great on him - he did leak though (heavy wetter) and I didn't have room for an additional insert (we use 2 inserts for both son and daughter). The colors are great and the inserts actually find their way out of the pockets in the wash (almost always) so you don't have to touch them when they are dirty. Overall they are super soft and the fit is really good
customer_reviews.author: Carly P

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for this mama that is just learning how to use cloth diapers! They absorb a lot of liquid and clean up easily!
customer_reviews.author: Colt Stout

customer_reviews.title: Leak
customer_reviews.text: These are great but they always leak after a few months. I’ve bought them 3x now and I’m not going to buy anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for about a month. I put 2 inserts in and my 18m old stays dry overnight, he isn't a heavy wetter though, what I don't like is sometimes he gets fluff on his bits so I wonder if these would last for a child's whole time in diapers
customer_reviews.author: Mommi4GoodDeals422

customer_reviews.title: Simple & great
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they are made in china. But they are so simple, easy to use, easy to clean, ADJUSTABLE, and affordable...give yourself a break and try them out. Especially if this is your first experience with cloth diapering! Research insert options, as microfiber isn't the best absorbency wise, but you can pair this diapers with whatever inserts you like.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Cox

customer_reviews.title: Really Helped
customer_reviews.text: My wife love the product as quality is good and we used it multiple times and would recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: BALA TADAVARTI

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! The diapers are amazing nice designs. 0 accidents and they are bigger than koalas brand
customer_reviews.author: Brenda ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Diapers
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know I send it to my nephew who became a father of a baby boy. Four years ago I gave similar ones to another niece that became a mother of a baby girl and se was happy with them. I didn’t, ask my nephew, but I presume the are. When you they got them they like it as far as I know.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent diapers. The fillers are way absorbent! I will buy again if I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft and fast to dry, good price
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot. They’re soft and fast to hang dry. My only issue is the narrow crotch. It makes it easier to put on baby but I get leg leaks when holding her on my hip.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: Grows with your baby!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is a one size fits all diaper that grows with your little one. No need to buy multiple sizes. The diapers work great. At night I use an extra insert and I have not had any issues. There are occasional leaks with poop, but I have seen the same with disposables as well. The best thing is they are saving me money and there are no chemicals which makes them a healthier, earth friendly, option. And did I mention how much money I can save?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 22 month old great. He is around 30 pounds for reference. Only holds about one pee but that’s fine because we’re potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Great Grand son who is allergic to disposable diapers
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Great Grand son who is allergic to disposable diapers. He was a only 29 weeks when born. 3 lbs 2 oz...he is now 12 lbs and they fit great and also fit the 27 lb G grand daughter. My granddaughter loves them and wish she would have gone to them earlier. She now has 3 sets of these.
customer_reviews.author: Cherijoy L Searle

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for price
customer_reviews.text: Overall we LOVE these diapers they fit well and are so cute. However the microfiber inserts do not absorb much at all and my 6 week old constantly leaks through them at night. It was an easy fix but now I have 12 inserts I dont know what to do with them. However, for the price I find the quality to be great and would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Courtney H

customer_reviews.title: great value for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: great value for cloth diapers, especially if you want to give it a try... but one of the diapers has very little or no elastic on the back. I do wash them on cold and hang to dry. I would buy these again and probably will depending on how well they hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Soft and absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and absorbent diapers. We don’t have many blowouts. When we do it’s usually my oops on not making sure they were on quite right. The inner lining of the diapers are very soft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price increased way to much but love the product
customer_reviews.text: I need to buy more but I can’t since you guys increased the price way to high!!!! I am glad I bought 18 of them before I had my baby. I need more but can’t afford it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are among my favorite pocket diapers and I've been using them for about ...
customer_reviews.text: These are among my favorite pocket diapers and I've been using them for about 5 months. They absorb well and I've had no problems with leaks or blow-outs. These appear to be the exact same as "Nora's Nursery" diapers; I have a set of both and the colors, snaps, and sizes are identical. Only the brand tag is different.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Carter

customer_reviews.title: Stitching ripped
customer_reviews.text: 3 diapers had rips in side of them after 4 months of use. My baby is barely crawling; so there is no reason why this should have happened. Tried looking for contact info for the company but apparently it doesn’t exist. The other diapers we have work well. The only other problem we’ve had, is even double lines they don’t get us through the night without a puddle of pee.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly cloth diaper to start with
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cloth diaper. I had no clue which one to buy so I bought this for trial basis. So far it is great. Only problem is my son gets diaper rashes when I leave the diaper on for more than two hours . If your child doesn’t get diaper rashes this is budget friendly cloth diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Adas 2019

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend these. These diapers leak like crazy. Wished I would’ve listened to the bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Guajardo

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: These are okay I suppose. They're definitely not my favorite. Out of 3 different types I have with comparable prices (mama koala, simple being and the alvababy) these are my least favorite. They don't hold as well and their patterns in my opinion look cheap. They're not terrible but for the same price I love the simple being diapers the best.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Coogan

product_meta.title: ALVABABY Baby Cloth Diapers One Size Adjustable Washable Reusable for Baby Girls and Boys 6 Pack with 12 Inserts 6BM98
feature_bullets: FASION & STYLISH －Why not get these reusable, washable super-absorbent and comfortable cloth nappies / diapers, which are also called modern cloth nappies (MCNs) or pocket nappies. For your baby, for the cost of buying disposable nappies, these reusable nappies and inserts will last you for a much longer period of time.

HIGN QUALITY, ADJUSTABLE, REUSABLE & WATERPROOF －Outer layer: polyester with waterproof and breathable TPU .It's convenient for mammy to carry baby while taking a walk or doing chores. Inner layer: suede cloth inside, it does not hold moisture itself ,the moisture get drawn away to the insert to keep your baby dry . Insert: each diaper would come with two 3-layer microfiber inserts. Insert dimension approx 13.7” x 5.5”

SAVE MONEY & ECO-FRIENDLY－Our reusable cloth diapers are designed for families who require premium products. Suitable for babies and toddlers 3kg-15kg (6.6 – 33 pounds) (a rough guide for reference only) .Length of Diaper: 15” in length X 13” in width. One size fits all– you can adjust the diaper to your desired size (S,M or L) by snapping onto different rows of buttons on the nappy.
HAPPY BABY －Hip snaps and crossover snaps to prevent “wing droop”. Washable, waterproof and breathable.Comfortable elastic legging area to prevent leaking. Package included: 6 diapers + 12 inserts.
SINCERE SERVICE & NO RISK －1 year guarantee. If you have any problems with the product, please feel free to contact us, we’ll send you a new one or refund your money of your choice.
